result.execSummary:
The defendant Choua Xiong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
DNA sample and surcharge. 
If the defendant successfully completes probation, the defendant may petition for expungment at the end of probation.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: Jail IMPOSED & STAYED for rule violations.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP (w/cover letter) - Signed by Court 3/8/17
of Sentencing After Revocation Hearing on 05-05-2015
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:40am. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody and w/Atty Kyle Reimann. Arguments by State; Defense. COURT makes findings. COURT ORDERS: WI State Prison 
Total 3 yrs & 3 months;  Initial Confinement 1 yr & 3 months; Extended Supervision 2 yrs.  283 days credit CONDITIONS: Assessment or Counseling; AODA; Corrective Thinking or Personal Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Absolute Sobriety - drugs or alcohol. Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after Court. Both PSI's to be kept confidential by State and Defense. Court remands Defendant to Marathon Cty Sheriff to be transported to Dodge Correctional. Adjourned: 10:02am.
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on April 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
IAS, LLC (sealed)
Sentencing hearing on April 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Case called: 9:33am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer for Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Kyle Reimann. Matter set for Status re: counsel. Atty Reimann has been appointed on this file. State and Defense request PSI. Atty Reimann will be inquiring Alternative PSI. COURT orders PSI. DATES: Sentencing After Revocation 3/20/15 @ 1pm - 1 hr. Adjourned: 9:35am.
Status conference on January 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 19, 2014 at 10:15 am.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:20
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer for Lance Leonhard.  Def appears with Atty Zachary Glascock.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
PLEA: Count 1>>Possession of Meth>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 18 months with Conditions of: I&S 60 days MCJ for rule violations, assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent including AODA and any follow thru, absolute sobriety, FTE/School, CC including DNA sample and surcharge. Has 3 days credit.
If the Defendant successfully completes probation the defendant may petition for expungement at the end of probation.
